Text:
Republicans in Congress want to raise taxes on most of American middle-class families.

Maybe it’s crazy - but I think we should tax the corporations bringing in record profits and driving inflation instead. We need middle-class tax cuts, not tax-hikes. https://t.co/HI6S2am1pj

Today the Biden Administration announced it will invest $450 million dollars on clearing port congestion. Along with with my Ocean Shipping Reform Act, this policy will end shipping delays and reduce prices for American families. #DemocratsDeliver https://t.co/MyaVZ8GmyF

Vladimir Putin is seeking to destabilize and fracture the NATO alliance. 

Instead, he's made it stronger and more unified than ever before. 

I joined @VictorBlackwell on @CNNnewsroom to discuss this and more: https://t.co/usXLMj2FxD

Though Mr. Arbery’s killers were convicted, lynchings continue.

I am a co-sponsor of the Emmitt Till Antilynching Act - a bill representing a policy our nation has failed to pass for over 100 years. I am working to ensure the 117th Congress is the one to finally pass this law

Lynching did not end with the brutal murder of Emmett Till, it did not end with the passage of the Civil Rights Act, and it did not end with the election of the first Black President. 

Ahmaud Arbery’s murder serves as a reminder of this. https://t.co/fjOf8eJkpW

Congratulations to the @VHS_Bulldogs wrestling team for their San Joaquin Section Championship! As a former collegiate wrestler I know how hard you work for moments like these — I hope all of you take the time to appreciate this accomplishment! https://t.co/gnWKzZCpk7
Happy President’s day — today we remember the contributions made by our greatest leaders. https://t.co/XzJmplFMXU

I joined @DeadlineWH to discuss my trip this weekend to meet with @natopapress. I will reaffirm America's support for NATO and convey a message of unity in the face of Russian aggression throughout Europe. https://t.co/Ff58DVbeNC

Insulin isn't new, it's not expensive to produce and it's not rare. But big pharma keeps raising prices — putting Americans’ health and financial stability at risk. That's why I have voted to cap the price of insulin at $35 a month. It's just commonsense.

Illegal deforestation harms ecosystems, indigenous communities, and our ability to fight climate change. That’s why I’ve introduced the “End Palm Oil Deforestation Act” to ensure palm oil products imported to the US contain only lawfully sourced palm oil. https://t.co/rZ0BEYk7zZ

Billie Holiday’s “Strange Fruit” stands as a testament to the racist violence of the American South.

Despite its recognition today, in the 1930’s the government and radio stations colluded to ensure Holiday’s recognition of lynchings would never be heard 
#BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/TTv6ZG8hfb

Members of Congress shouldn't be allowed to use inside knowledge to buy and trade stocks. 

That's why I'm supporting the #STOCKAct to prohibit Members of Congress from buying and trading stocks.

High gas prices hurt families. It makes you pay more at the pump and at the grocery store, too. Yet as middle class families struggle to pay more, companies like Exxon are making more money than ever. That’s why I’m taking on these corporations in Congress https://t.co/lCvDD9ZQOd

Recently my staff presented a Congressional Commendation to Willis Jepson Middle School for their exemplary work. They were recently recognized as a “School to Watch” for the third time. I’m excited to welcome the Jaguars to our nation’s Capitol later this year! https://t.co/DTDOlkY36C

Climate change poses a dire threat to our future. I want my grandchildren to grow up enjoying California’s diverse ecosystems and natural abundance. That’s why I’m working to build new water reservoirs, a green energy grid and to reduce the threat of wildfires across our state. https://t.co/65uf5nEFmw

In 1968 Bob Beamon achieved what no one could’ve imagined — he broke the long jump world record by almost two feet. But just months before this feat, Bob  was kicked off his team and his wife was fired for participating in a civil rights protest. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/ZcQpUaOrB3

It’s simple — taxpayer dollars shouldn’t be spent on goods that don’t create good paying American jobs. That’s why I’m fighting for Make It In America legislation - to create good-paying union jobs at home. It’s time that the rest of Congress get on board. https://t.co/wD3zQZMxU7

We have more work to do, but the job growth America has seen under the Biden administration is historic. We will build on it in 2022 and beyond and work every day to make life easier for working families across America. https://t.co/FzMpfmoNcb
Happy to be with my Valentine today and wishing all of you a lovely Valentine’s Day as well! https://t.co/NaUmOFYA7D

I’m pleased the Federal Transit Administration has awarded $3.4 Million to build a new zero-emission ferry service connecting San Francisco and Solano County. This program will reduce carbon emissions, reduce commute times, and keep Solano County connected to other regions. https://t.co/PSJaR1Smzi

We cannot stand idly by while our children and grandchildren live with the specter of gun violence haunting their schools. While we pray for those who lost their lives that is not enough - we must act.
I am working to renew this law along with putting in place common-sense policies to prevent mass tragedies like the one we witnessed in Parkland four years ago.
I fought for the first assault weapons ban in the nation while in the California Assembly - which became the basis of a successful federal assault weapons ban until it expired in 2004.
Through the proliferation of assault weapons and a lack of regulation on gun purchases our country has become the capitol of gun violence in the world.

Four years ago a gunman walked into Stoneman Douglass High School in Parkland Florida and killed 17 students and staff. Disgracefully, we have allowed this uniquely American tragedy to become commonplace. https://t.co/TaIkfAnfDK
Patti and I are hoping you have a great Super Bowl Sunday with friends and family! We’re looking forward to a great game!

Yesterday I presented the 60th AMW with a Congressional Record Statement commending their bravery during the Afghanistan evacuations. This statement ensures their service and sacrifice will forever be remembered as part of our nation’s historical records. https://t.co/xSCGDTT6AL

Happy birthday to President Lincoln - born Feb. 12th 1809. Lincoln represents the best of America - a self-made man who was born in a log cabin to illiterate parents who became America’s greatest president. His unyielding moral convictions are an inspiration to this day

Today I visited the brave Airmen of Travis Air Force Base to thank them for their committed service to this nation and their critical role in evacuating our citizens, allies and diplomats from Afghanistan. Their bravery in the face of uncertainly and danger saved countless lives.

-Ban Members of Congress from owning and trading stocks 

-Renewed the Violence Against Women Act 

-Keep the government open and pass my bill to address the supply chain and inflation crises 

And the work isn’t over. https://t.co/geM8ngyr03

-Protect the US economy and help us remain competitive with China and other nations

-Rebuild the US Postal Service 

-Protect workers from workplace sexual harassment and end forced arbitration

THREAD: Helping the American people is more important than partisan bickering - that’s why we’re working hard to deliver results for the American people. Congress and President Biden have recently passed bipartisan bills to:

Hiram Revels became the first Black Senator in 1870. While only a few years later Mississippi would send Blanche Bruce, another Black man to the Senate, it would be almost 100 years before another Black Senator would take office. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/XxDNzlGiqG

Netflix made $5.3 billion last year but paid just a 1.1% tax rate. The #BuildBackBetter Act would create universal pre-k, paid family leave, and lower healthcare costs by simply requiring giant corporations like Netflix to finally pay their fair share in taxes. https://t.co/206UBmReZZ

Green energy isn’t just good climate policy —it’s good energy policy. Renewable energy projects are now more cost efficient than fossil fuel powered plants. That’s why I voted for the Infrastructure Bill, to invest billions of dollars in a cost-saving green power grid. https://t.co/XIspXSb7ow

@RepDustyJohnson and I are working hard to make our "Ocean Shipping Reform Act" law because it will help address inflation and supply chain concerns, correct trade imbalances the U.S. has with other nations, and support our economy. https://t.co/PSwIrYf8eh

I'm laser-focused on getting costs down for the middle class. Prices on essential goods are simply unacceptable right now. 

The House recently passed my Ocean Shipping Reform Act to address inflation and the supply chain crisis, and I'm working to ensure it becomes law.

Simply put, Members of Congress shouldn’t be able to use insider information to trade individual stocks. 

That’s why I support the STOCK Act to ban stock trading by Members of Congress.

Big corporations think they can violate workers rights without consequence — because they can. That’s why we need the #PROAct. This law would finally allow penalties for big corporations like Amazon who violate worker rights to protect shareholder profits https://t.co/hMOEKJ3jaY

Marsha P. Johnson helped lead protests against  the harassment of the LGBT+ community by the NYPD in 1969. Though she is known for her role at Stonewall, Johnson helped lead the fight for AIDS research, for Gay and Trans rights and against police violence #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/2E3keMCdb6

Today I voted for the Global Respect Act. This law is an important step towards ensuring the safety and dignity of LGBT+ individuals worldwide. This bill will ensure those who violate LGBT+ individuals’ rights cannot enter our borders. Let’s continue this work at home and abroad.

Americans are living through the best labor market in half a century, and pay for low-wage workers is up. This is historic progress made possible by @HouseDemocrats and @POTUS.

There's more work to do, and you can count on us achieving it #ForThePeople. 
https://t.co/3lvXfv4lYm

The U.S. Postal Service provides an essential service that every American relies on. 

Today, I'll vote for the Postal Service Reform Act to strengthen USPS and ensure it functions efficiently for every American to enjoy. Read more below:
https://t.co/69jgYFmple

As one of the leading supporters in Congress of Make it in America and Buy American policies, I applaud @POTUS for the progress he’s made to advance these policies and grow the American middle class. https://t.co/8BSma0jsaY

Today, I voted to end the shameful practice of forced arbitration of sexual assault and harassment in the workplace. For far too long, Americans who experience sexual harassment or assault have been forced into the shadows. This vote is a step towards finally righting that wrong.
I’m happy to see my young constituents making their voices heard about an issue that’s important to them — chocolate milk. https://t.co/mq2LM15eCQ

A. Philip Randolph was a lifelong champion for civil rights and economic justice. He fought for Black workers by organizing the Brotherhood of Sleeping Car Porters, served as a role model for future civil rights leaders and organized the March on Washington.#BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/BeQaGX1nqU

Farmers have a tough job keeping America fed. I’ve been working with the Biden Administration to help farmers by building new water storage in California, improving rural broadband access and ensuring their exports don’t face unfair foreign competition. https://t.co/pkJ5xRKD8n
I’ve enacted legislation into law to address this issue, and I won’t rest until those policies are fully implemented and this issue is resolved.
What we’ve learned is that it doesn’t need to be this way. The military must transform its culture of neglect in this arena into a culture of safety.

As Chair of the Armed Services Subcommittee on Readiness, I’ve conducted oversight into this issue and heard testimony from several bereaved family members who lost their children in preventable training accidents.
Tonight, @60Minutes is airing a segment I contributed to on the horrific rise in preventable military training deaths we’ve seen in recent years. https://t.co/Fb9dfiXogX

I just voted to pass the America COMPETES Act. This bill will ensure American companies can compete with foreign competitors and invest millions in developing new technologies. The COMPETES Act will help rebuild American manufacturing and create good-paying American jobs. https://t.co/GvfiwqR3Vd

#RosaParks planned her civil disobedience knowing she faced the threat of arrest and violent reprisal at the hands of white terrorists. Her actions sparked the Montgomery Bus Boycott, fueled the fight for civil rights and continue to inspire us #RestInPower #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/vJKYrgrywx
That’s because it is the best job creation on record. https://t.co/zoFQmXGehe

January saw over 450,000 Americans re-enter the economy. Despite the Omicron surge, the Biden Boom is still growing our economy, putting people to work and getting us back on track https://t.co/OBUdUcDcJS

152 years ago the 15th Amendment was passed, guaranteeing citizens the right to vote. Today we must continue to protect this right from new methods of voter suppression. 

That is why I’m working hard protecting the right to vote and prevent discriminatory voter suppression laws.
Today I spoke on the importance of my Ocean Shipping Reform Act which will help bring about an end to our supply chain crisis. Watch below https://t.co/EApNQjaYfn

Born into slavery Sojourner Truth fought back. She escaped and became a leading figure in both the abolition movement and the feminist movement. Sojourner Truth understood the struggle against racism and sexism are deeply intertwined #BlackHistoryMonth 
https://t.co/0YWW1z9fwi
He looks like a good boy but Chesty’s got a lot of work in front of him, learning “sit” “stay” and “go ashore” https://t.co/lsYUzlyR9B

Patti and I are saddened to hear of the shooting last night in Oroville and are praying for the victims and their families. 

Gun violence is an epidemic in America and we need to take action to limit the spread of deadly weapons.
https://t.co/mq77XgutrY

They have their work cut out for them if they want to stop this popular bill. Our “Ocean Shipping Reform Act” passed the House with 364 bipartisan votes because it will lower costs on essential goods for Americans, support our economy, and address the supply chain crisis. https://t.co/CZYZq0i6Vc

Growing up, sports gave me a place to have fun and create lifelong friendships. I’m celebrating National Girls and Women in Sports Day today because all kids should get that experience and to be able to look up at our country’s greatest athletes and see people who look like them

Happy Groundhog Day, here’s hoping Punxsutawney Phil sees more rain in the forecast!

I’m working to ensure CA has the reservoir infrastructure needed to retain rain and snowmelt, protecting farmers, wetlands,everyday people from the greatest harms of California droughts.

Tonight, Rep. Barbara Lee’s achievements are being recognized with a documentary about her career. Congresswoman Lee broke the glass ceiling as a congressional aide, fought beside the first Black woman in Congress, and became one of the most accomplished Members of Congress.
@SenatorLujan Get well soon, Senator. Patti and I are praying for a full recovery.

America is a nation founded on the principles of equality and justice for all. As a member of Congress, I am not satisfied with maintaining the status quo. I will work every day with my colleagues to enact policies that help advance the wellbeing and rights of every American.

Through tireless advocacy, sacrifice, and backbreaking work by countless unsung heroes throughout history, America’s original sin of slavery was formally outlawed. 157 years later, the battle for true justice and equality continues.
157 years ago the Constitution was ratified to include the 13th Amendment, which  formally abolished slavery in this nation.
Patti and I are wishing a happy Lunar New Year to all those celebrating. We wish everyone a happy and blessed new year.

As Harriet Tubman said, “Every great dream begins with a dreamer. But any dream is only as strong as the strength of those who fight for it. Power concedes nothing without a demand, and those demands are as needed now as they ever were.”

If we are truly to achieve equality, we must strive to correct these injustices.
 
Though there is much work to be done, there is hope. We must put in the work.

This month, we honor the rich cultural, political and economic legacy of Black Americans during Black History Month. Sadly, Black Americans still face rampant inequality and discrimination in housing, employment, education, and criminal justice.

The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act is helping us rebuild American bridges, highways and airports. The law created countless grant programs for local governments to access billions in federal infrastructure funds. To find more information go to https://t.co/OixR8GGqX8
I joined @Phil_Mattingly yesterday on @CNN to discuss the situation in #Ukraine. You can watch our full discussion below: https://t.co/MS0oxagje0
Excited for a great matchup between two California teams today. I look forward to the 49ers bringing the NFC championship home to the Bay. https://t.co/xcNQNK68ja
The Biden boom is here — 2021 marked the highest economic growth since 1984. We’re getting Americans back to work, rebuilding American manufacturing and getting the middle class back on track.

Congrats to a member of the Aggie family moving on from being a mustang to being a Bronco. While I’ll still be rooting for the 49ers I can’t wait to see what coach Nathaniel Hackett will be doing in the AFC next year! https://t.co/4mRwxZsqgD

The CSU’s are right; students shouldn’t pay more. That’s why I voted against any tuition increase proposed by UC’s or CSU’s 

As a young man I benefitted from California’s world-class public universities, and I’m committed to ensuring students today do too https://t.co/JqvTRqpLPR

Today we recognize and remember the 6 million Jews murdered by Nazi Germany and recognize the millions of other groups that were brutally targeted massacred by this evil regime in the Holocaust. 

We must put a stop to antisemitism, bigotry, and hate in any form. #NeverAgain.

Whether it’s reducing commute time, filling potholes or creating new good-paying jobs, the Infrastructure and Jobs Act will have a positive impact on each of our lives.

I enjoyed answering constituent questions about this law with @RepThompson 

https://t.co/UWS3Vk8JY9

I joined @ChrisJansing on @MSNBC this morning to discuss the ongoing situation in #Ukraine. 

You can watch our full conversation below: https://t.co/7keSNlIaF9
I’m joining @ChrisJansing on @MSNBC at 11:15 am ET/8:15 am PT to discuss the situation in #Ukraine. https://t.co/YHMgnXmqvU

We have more work to do, but America’s economy is back on track thanks to Democratic policies like the American Rescue Plan and the Infrastructure and Jobs Act. 

https://t.co/weQcejEndj

I’ve spent years passing Make It In America legislation to create good-paying American manufacturing jobs. The America Competes Act is the next step. It’ll rebuild a domestic manufacturing base, decrease reliance on China, and rebuild the middle-class https://t.co/VEI3M2bvyR

This week the federal government is starting free N95 mask distribution  programs. This will allow millions of Americans to protect themselves better than ever before at no cost. Common sense approaches to public health are the key to reopening the economy https://t.co/s5chzKkqxJ

TONIGHT: join @RepThompson and I for a town hall discussion on the Infrastructure and Jobs Act. 

We’ll discuss the infrastructure investments in the law and the thousands of jobs it‘ll create. To receive the Zoom link RSVP to the Thompson.Townhall@Mail.House.Gov https://t.co/WSeWJFrFQp

One year ago President Biden lifted  discriminatory and transphobic policies, ensuring trans soldiers, airmen, marines, and sailors receive the respect and protection afforded to any member of our military. Let’s continue the work to ensure our military reflects our shared values

Climate change has made wildfires a yearlong danger. That’s why I’ve spent years fighting for more federal support. I’d like to thank the President Biden for taking this issue seriously and investing much-needed resources to fight this threat
https://t.co/DR76Ia4N3i

Please join @RepThompson and I  for a town hall discussion on the Infrastructure and Jobs Act tomorrow. We’ll discuss the investments it’ll bring to Solano, Yolo and Contra Costa Counties and the of jobs it will create. To receive the Zoom link RSVP to the email to below https://t.co/6py93XAaBO
@WhiteHouse has launched a phone line for Americans to order their free at-home covid test kits. You can call 1-800-232-0233 from 8 a.m. – 12 a.m. EST seven days a week or text 1-888-720-7489.
Got it done! Congratulations @49ers on advancing to the NFC Championship Game! https://t.co/5bNkS2wPfw
Let’s go @49ers!

Wildfire victims working to rebuild their lives should not be burdened by an unclear tax system, that is why today I asked  the IRS to remove the bureaucratic red tape and clarify how wildfire victims can use credit from the Fire Victim Trust to rebuild and replace what was lost. https://t.co/FM25NPvKWg

Veterans’ healthcare access shouldn’t be hampered by a bureaucratic VA enrollment process.

Accessing care in a timely matter is too important. That’s why I voted for the EVEST Act, to simplify our VA system and ensure veterans receive the mental and physical healthcare they need

Beginning today the federal government will be offering free at home Covid tests to every household in America. As To order your tests click the link below. For those unable to order tests online a phone hotline will be launched in the coming days
https://t.co/7u4L8vtfi2

Dr. King’s final days were spent fighting for the dignity of union workers in Memphis because he understood that workplace safety and fair pay are crucial parts of addressing the legacy of racism in America. Today we must continue his fight for economic justice and worker rights.
Today we face many of the same obstacles as those 60 years ago including the Senate filibuster but I will continue to defend Rev. King’s work to secure Voting Rights for all. #WeWantVotingRights

Thousands of activists gave their time, their liberty and some gave even their lives in the campaign to finally guarantee Voting Rights for all Americans. I will not stand by as these victories are eroded by courts, state legislators and authoritarian politicians.
Today we continue the fight to protect Voting Rights, recognizing the unparalleled contributions made by Dr. King and all those who campaigned for this goal.
Today we honor all of those who walked with Dr. King and stood beside him in his fight for dignity, justice and equal participation in democracy.

Today we honor Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. For his contributions to this nation. As a leader, as a man and as a relentless fighter for justice. This holiday not only commemorates his legacy, but commemorates the contributions of the entire civil rights movement.

The Infrastructure and Jobs Act is bringing $4.25 Billion to California. Californians know our bridges must hold up to daily traffic and be prepared for an earthquake. This bill provides our state with the resources to ensure our bridge infrastructure is prepared for anything

Passing the #FreedomToVote Act is one of the most important votes I’ve taken in Congress. It protects the unassailable right to vote against unprecedented attacks from Republican state legislatures. The Senate must immediately pass this critically important legislation.

Today I voted for the Guard and GI Bill Parity Act, ensuring those that keep us safe get the benefits they deserve.

When the National Guard responds to emergencies, they risk their lives on behalf of the US. It's time we start recognizing their active duty time as equally worthy

Democrats are working to solve the supply chain crisis, we: 

✔️ Passed my Ocean Shipping Reform Act to lower costs for American families.

✔️ Reduced inflation by 37.5% in December compared to November.

✔️ Released the strategic petroleum reserve to lower gas prices.

Unaffordable healthcare ruins lives. That’s why I voted with my House colleagues to cap the price of insulin at $35, saving middle-class Americans thousands of dollars a year while saving lives in the process. It's time the Senate act, save lives, and save Americans’ pocketbooks.

President Biden is right, we cannot allow a small minority of Senators to use procedural rules to block voting rights. Democracy is too important, its time to pass the #JohnLewisVotingRightsAct https://t.co/AdVlFve1o6

Current Covid-19 case rates are higher than at any point of the pandemic, putting the elderly, the immunosuppressed, and children at risk of dangerous long-term health effects. 

Take precautions, get vaccinated, wear an N-95, and get tested if possible. https://t.co/u7w6mx6U2Y

Our children and grandchildren are growing up in a world at risk. Climate change threatens their American Dream and puts their health at risk. Too many have already witnessed dangerous wildfires, mudslides, and drought. Let’s listen to science and act on climate change now. https://t.co/DzJXhdMEpF

State legislatures across the country are enacting laws to undermine American democracy by suppressing the vote and allowing the overturn of legitimate elections.

It is time for the U.S. Senate to do its job and pass John Lewis Voting Rights Act to end these anti-democratic acts
Let’s pass the PRO Act and ensure this generation and those to come have the same access to the American dream that our parents did.

This once-in-a-generation legislation will help workers access the basic right of unionization by protecting their right to organize and taking action against the corporations like Amazon that illegally suppress their workers’ right to form a union.

As Republicans attacked workers and offshored manufacturing it became harder for American workers to live out the American dream their parents had enjoyed. 

That is why I am a cosponsor of the PRO Act.
Unfortunately, corporations and their conservative backers undermined this shared prosperity to ensure higher shareholder profits at the expense of working class Americans who built this country.

I grew up with the greatest middle-class America has ever seen. Strong unions and a domestic manufacturing base allowed hardworking Americans to live a comfortable life and put their kids through college.
Wages are up and unemployment has fallen at the fastest rate in a generation. https://t.co/eQ0C7mrBZG

Working-class families shouldn't be struggling to afford heat in the winter or to keep the lights on. That's why I voted to support hard working California families by covering high energy costs. https://t.co/lNTwet1eWQ

Patti and I are praying for Officer Brian Sicknick’s family and remembering him and his sacrifice today. We commend every U.S. Capitol Police Officer who bravely defended the U.S. Capitol and our democratic process on January 6th, 2021. https://t.co/c86iHOJN7U

I was pleased to join my colleague, @RepThompson, and local officials yesterday to discuss the critically important investments into local infrastructure that will be made thanks to the new bipartisan infrastructure law: 

https://t.co/hZb5r5RKl9
America added more jobs in President Biden’s first 11 months than the last four Republican administrations combined.

In the 4th quarter of 2021, the United States economy is estimated to have grown by 5.5% or 6%. By comparison, China is estimated to have grown by just 3.5% in the same quarter. Democratic policies are creating a transformational economic recovery for the American people.

The 6.4 million jobs @POTUS and @HouseDemocrats helped create in 2021 with policies like the #AmericanRescuePlan is also the most in a single year in American history. I want to build on this historic progress by enacting the #BuildBackBetter Act into law as well.

When @POTUS took office, unemployment was at 6.7%—today it is down to 3.9%. That’s the fastest decline in history. Before we passed the #AmericanRescuePlan, CBO predicted the U.S. wouldn’t get here until 2026. This is historic progress for the American people.

I'm grateful for partnerships with @RepThompson and other leaders throughout the region who share my commitment to rebuilding our infrastructure with American materials and workers. https://t.co/6KYaTJtp5p

@RepThompson and I spoke with local officials in Vacaville today about the tremendous benefits that are coming to the community thanks to the historic infrastructure law. Read more about it below:  https://t.co/AXL4NW4FnE

It was a pleasure to meet with the incredible men and women of @Travis60AMW today. As Chair of the Armed Services Subcommittee on Readiness, I work every day to support their critically important mission for our nation’s safety and security. https://t.co/lUnX8QaqD2
I’ll always work to support public education, and I thank everyone at Suisun Valley Elementary for their time today.

In Congress, I work every day to support public educators and students. Last year, I secured over $25 million for this school district in the “American Rescue Plan” to help support students and teachers, safely reopen our schools.
California Distinguished Schools demonstrate significant gains in narrowing the achievement gap and an imitable commitment to the wellbeing of their students.

THREAD: It was a pleasure to join Suisun Valley Elementary today and discuss the commitment to education students and faculty alike have shown that has made their school a California Distinguished School. https://t.co/9QAYFUOiYE

Today I'm visiting Solano and Yolo counties to meet with servicemen and women, veterans, educators, emergency responders, healthcare workers, and students. Though we're adding jobs, getting products back on shelves, and reinvesting in our communities there's still work to be done https://t.co/FLpvBRMeJd

As we reflect on the horrors of #January6th, it is imperative that we take a moment to read this piece and understand what is unfolding before us. American democracy is under attack, and we all have a responsibility to protect it. https://t.co/UEdYFkTFwb
As we think about what transpired a year ago, we must all reaffirm our commitment to American democracy and work to ensure it is maintained for generations to come.

One year later, my colleagues are continuing to investigate those who premeditated and organized this attack. This important work will carry on until we have a comprehensive understanding of what took place and can bring those responsible to justice.
We mourn the senseless violence that occurred that day and the loss of life while praising the heroic actions of those that defended the U.S. Capitol--the citadel of democracy--from attack.

Tragically, lives were lost on January 6, 2021, and in the days and months that followed due to the unimaginable trauma experienced by courageous and heroic Capitol Police officers that fought to protect the Capitol.

Tragically, lives were lost on January 6, 2021, and in the days and months that followed due to the unimaginable trauma experienced by courageous and heroic Capitol Police officers that fought to protect the Capitol.

That night we returned to the House floor--hours after the attack--to finish our hallowed work and certify the 2020 election. We sent a message to the world that nothing can come in the way of our Constitutional obligations and our dedication to American democracy.

On that day I said, "Democracy is fragile - it is our responsibility to protect it. Americans have upheld this responsibility through more than two centuries of challenges and adversity. Today, and every day moving forward, we must continue this work."

One year ago today, a violent mob descended on the U.S. Capitol in an attempt to stage a coup and end American democracy. They threatened members of Congress with violence if we performed our Constitutional duty to certify the lawful result of the 2020 Presidential election.

A new study shows the stimulus checks from the #AmericanRescuePlan @HouseDemocrats passed decreased food insecurity by 42%, decreased financial instability by 43%, and reduced anxiety and depression by 20%. https://t.co/26za9d2LUw
This graphic from @WSJ highlights why it’s so important to wear N95 masks to prevent #COVID19, especially while we experience a surge in cases due to the #Omicron Variant. https://t.co/wLzHIoq09Y

The economic recovery Democratic policies created is helping Americans and putting people back to work at a historic rate. In December, the private sector more than doubled its expected job growth. Let’s keep up the work and #BuildBackBetter https://t.co/OnuuroqjNv

American infrastructure needs a jumpstart. This year new federal investments from the Infrastructure and Jobs Act will make their way to our communities. 2022 will be a year of continued job growth, community development, and infrastructure revitalization.
Some good news heading into 2022. https://t.co/gV8B0FRhXq
3/3: Our hearts are with Senator Reid’s family and loved ones during this difficult time.

2/3: As Senate Democratic leader for a dozen years, he played a crucial role in passing the Affordable Care Act and passing the most vital economic recovery package in Congress since the Great Depression. He loved his home state of Nevada and his country dearly.

1/3: Patti and I are deeply saddened to learn of Harry Reid’s passing. 

Senator Reid was one of the strongest voices in the U.S. Senate for over three decades. He championed policies that saved lives, created opportunities for the middle class, and protected our environment.

From my family to yours, have a Merry Christmas!

I refuse to accept assault weapons and school shootings as the status quo, and I refuse to make our children accept this as normal. I will keep working to stem the tide of gun violence in our nation.
The bill saved countless lives, but unfortunately the federal assault weapons ban expired in 2004—leaving our children and our communities more vulnerable as a result.
Just five years later, Senator Dianne Feinstein use my bill as the basis for the federal assault weapons ban that was signed into law.

In 1989, I introduced in the California Legislature what would become the first assault weapons ban anywhere in America. I introduced the bill in response to a school shooting in my then State Senate district.

The news reports of that kindergarten classroom remain fresh in my mind, alongside those of the innumerable school shootings before and since. While we pray for those who have lost their lives we must also take action to prevent a tragedy like this one from ever occurring again.
